subproject.description: The project resource is used to cover the human resource (HR) and non-HR operational cost requirement of the Transition Recovery Programme (TRP) which runs from 2008-2012. subproject.description:
1. Improved social conditions and livelihoods of conflict-affected persons through vocational training and livelihood inputs such as cattle, poultry, seeds, fertilizer, barbed wire, fishing nets, and vallams (traditional boats).
2. Enabling environment created for social transformation and peace building targeting youth through sports in conflict-prone villages while strengthening institutions and decision-making bodies at the community and district levels.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: TRP - Community for Peace (C4P

subproject.description:
This project has 5 specific outputs as per below:
(1) Sustainable livelihood opportunities created for crisis affected communities; (2) Micro-credit and micro enterprise development support provided to vulnerable communities and individuals with limited access to credit; (3) Community focused housing provided to crisis affected communities; (4) Access of crisis affected communities to socio-economic services enhanced through rehabilitation of community infrastructure; (5) Enhanced social cohesion and gender empowerment across and within communities in crisis affected areas; and (6) Community environmental management mainstreamed into the recovery process of crisis affected communities.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: TRP-CIDA Community Rehab.Proje

subproject.description: The project supports the enhancement of social transformation as part of TRP’s community and area-based development approach in support of the resettlement and reintegration of IDPs, returnees and host communities in the North and East of Sri Lanka. The project aims to strengthen the social transformation and social cohesion outputs of the TRP, including its mainstreaming into other donor-funded projects and capacity-development of TRP staff and partners.
subproject.gender code: Gender Equality as a principal objective
subproject.title: TRP - Enhanced Social Transfor

subproject.description: Sustainable resettlement of returnees in the recently resettled villages of the Mullaitivu and Kilinochchi districts and reducing tensions within and between the target villages by improving their overall socio-economic conditions through construction and renovation of critical community infrastructure, provision of livelihood support, support to micro-credit and micro-enterprise development, as well as strengthening of community structures.
